body_html:
Hi,
I have some continuous integration tests set up for some of my projects, where I run the code on small training sets and didn't notice any change in performance when I was switching from 0.11 to 0.12. The integration tests are running on CPU though. Maybe could you check for the first epochs if you get the same results in 0.11 vs 0.12 via CPU? This would tell us that there is something going on with the GPU stuff maybe. Also, do you maybe have any random gens that are not seeded?

body:
Hi,
I have some continuous integration tests set up for some of my projects, where I run the code on small training sets and didn't notice any change in performance when I was switching from 0.11 to 0.12. The integration tests are running on CPU though. Maybe could you check for the first epochs if you get the same results in 0.11 vs 0.12 via CPU? This would tell us that there is something going on with the GPU stuff maybe. Also, do you maybe have any random gens that are not seeded?
